about.policy:
Internet privacy is a right. Why should we accept that we wouldn't accept in our daily life (offline) ? For many years, private companies such as Google, Facebook, etc... as well as government agencies spy on us to gather informations about us everyday on the web. However, we are able to counter this mass spying using cryptography but too few projects allow us to protect us properly. But today, we are fortunate to have a safe alternative for our mails: ProtonMail, which allows encryption end-to-end thereof.
It's in that perspective that we launched the development of Quanta Cloud, to offer an alternative for storing securely your documents online. Our policy requires us to encrypt end-to-end files making you the only true owner thereof.

adventure.phase1:
Phase 1

This first phase is to create a complete website called 'features' for the project presentation in general, developers and additional informations about security.

Expected launching date : End January 2016
adventure.phase2:
Phase 2

The second phase involves the development of management interface for your files. The interface will only include the basic features (such encryption will be of course the first to be established). Once completed, the limited beta will be launched. It will include about fifty people.

Expected launching date : July 2016
adventure.phase3:
Phase 3

The third phase involves the purchase of our own servers and open public beta with additional features (in addition to the basic features). Our servers will support about 1,000 to 2,000 people.

Expected launching date : January 2017
adventure.phase4:
Phase 4

The fourth phase is the release of a completely stable version of the interface (probably with performance improvements, simplifications of certain features, etc ...). The launch of the first stable version will come with a purchase of several servers with high storage capacity.

Expected launching date : April-May 2017
adventure.phase5:
Phase 5

The fifth and final phase will mainly launch other projects under the name Kantum Technologies and the financing of new servers. The interface will go through a strict analysis to significantly improve the user experience.

Expected launching date : January 2018

donate.whyDonateTxt:
Our team consists of students, not professionals strictly speaking. So, we are not paid by any job. If we need money, we must devote our time to work, which's less time to work on Quanta Cloud or on our studies.
If by your donations, we manage to strike a balance and we don't necessarily need to work to support us, then we can devote ourselves even more to the development of Quanta Cloud.

help.losePwd: I lost my password, how to recover it ?
help.losePwdAns:
If this is your identification password, then click on "Forgot password?" on the login page. Your password will be reset and an email will be sent with a temporary password.
However, if this is your decryption password, it's impossible for us to redefine one and you must consider that all your files are lost.
help.whoCanAccessMyFilesAns: Only you can access your files. Without going into technical terms, you need a unique key (personal) to encrypt and decrypt your files and this key is itself encrypted using your encryption password. Thus, nobody, not even we, can access your files, you apart.
help.howEncryptedAns: Your files are encrypted end-to-end thanks to OpenPGP.js at your browser using your personal key, also decrypted in your browser. Thus, data that are sent are already encrypted and nobody else except you can decrypt them.
help.howFunded: How is funded Quanta Cloud ? It receives helps from companies ?
help.howFundedAns: No, Quanta Cloud's policy is to not belong to any company (except ours), not to receive help from big companies, in order to not jeopardize our privacy policy, etc... Thus, Quanta Cloud is only funded through your donations. You can take a ride in the 'Donate' section if you are interested.
help.helpTerrorism: Are you trying to help terrorists or evil organizations ?
help.helpTerrorismAns: No, we advocate privacy, certainly helping the world get a better privacy, we unwittingly helping terrorism. But we're in the same situation as ProtonMail. In any case, even if we wouldn't develop Quanta Cloud, terrorists and any other person or group of people will encrypt their data.
help.anotherQuestionAns: Our FAQ will be updated as we receive new questions. You can contact us at : <b>quantacloud [AT] protonmail [DOT] ch

security.communicationsEncryptionTxt:
Quanta Cloud uses TLS 1.2 technology with a certificate generated by Let's Encrypt to secure communications between your devices and servers. With this technology, the information you send (your username, password, etc ...) and receive (personal information, etc ...) are encrypted using an algorithm named AES-256 allowing an encryption by AES - 256 bits.
So, even if your communications are intercepted, they can't be decrypted and no one can steal the information in transit between you and the servers
security.filesEncryptionTxt:
We use end-to-end encryption. This means that whatever the stage (upload, storage, download), your file will still be encrypted. Thus, if someone intercept data, the attacker will never read your files. The encryption algorithm used is RSA with OpenPGP.js (which is a complete and open source implementation of OpenPGP) which allows a 4096 bits encryption. When creating an account, the user is assigned two personal and unique keys in order to encrypt and decrypt his files. With this principle, we can't decrypt your files. When you are logging, your two keys will be stored in your browser to enable the encryption and decryption locally. This keeps the encrypted stream.

security.SwissLaws: Under the protection of Swiss laws
security.SwissLawsTxt: Our servers will be located in Switzerland, as most projects that use encryption as a way to defend against mass espionage. The first advantage is its neutrality with the EU and the US, making it virtually invulnerable against government intrusions. In addition, Switzerland has legislation enabling encryption without restrictions and without conditions (unlike the USA with the Patriot Act). Our servers will be located in Switzerland, secured against physical intrusions. Your files remain encrypted on server, making them invulnerable, even in the face of physical attacks.
security.tripleAuthTxt:
Only you can access to your files. That is why we have developed a authentication system with 3 layers. The principle is quite simple: You enter your login/mail and password and submit, this is the first security layer. Once you're logged, you need to enter your passphrase to be able to decrypt your key, then allows the decryption of your files, this corresponds to the second layer. But we thought that an additional layer provides more security. After your passphrase, a mail with a code will be send, you need to enter the received code on the page to be totally logged. All this may be a little long, but strengthens the security of your account.
This system is inspired by the double-authentification made by some sites like Gmail or Facebook.
